title: Business & Finance
text:
Airbnb's second-quarter revenue nearly quadrupled, rebounding from the lows of the pandemic as domestic travel lifted the home-sharing giant's fortunes.

---

Home prices surged in almost every corner of the U.S. in the second quarter as robust demand continued to overwhelm the supply of housing for sale.

---

Boeing's Starliner space capsule launch could be delayed several months, as the company will likely need to remove it from atop a rocket for repairs.

---

Reddit said it raised $410 million from Fidelity at a valuation of about $10 billion and that it expects to secure additional financial commitments.

---

Jump, one of the world's largest high-frequency trading firms, will launch a unit that executes stock orders for individual investors.

---

The S&P 500 and Dow rose 0.3% and 0.04%, respectively, to close at records. The Nasdaq added 0.35%.

---

Adidas said it agreed to sell Reebok to Authentic Brands Group for up to about $2.5 billion.

---

Alibaba announced new policies to combat sexual harassment, a response to sexual-assault allegations by a female employee.
